com.lge.qcircle.template

Class QCircleTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lge.qcircle.template.QCircleTemplate

  • public class QCircleTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides design templates for LG QuickCircle.

    There are 5 templates:

    • empty content
    • content with a horizontal sidebar
    • content with a vertical sidebar
    • content with 2 topbars
    • content with 2 sidebars
    In order to get the layout, see TemplateType.
    In addition, you can add a title or a back button into each layout described above.

    This class supports APIs for setting layout, changing attributes of Views in the layout, and setting fullscreen intent.

    See Also:
    TemplateType

    • Constructor Detail

      • QCircleTemplate

        public QCircleTemplate(Context context)
        creates a template with an empty content.
        Parameters:
        context - Activity which has the template.
        It should be an Activity because the template will close the Activity when the cover is opened.
        If it is null, other APIs will not work and report errors.

      • QCircleTemplate

        public QCircleTemplate(Context context,
               int templateId)
        creates a template with the given layout.
        Parameters:
        context - Activity which has the template.
        It should be an Activity because the template will close the Activity when the cover is opened.
        If it is null, other APIs will not work and report errors.
        templateId - ID of the layout to use

      • QCircleTemplate

        public QCircleTemplate(Context context,
               TemplateType type)
        creates a template with the given template type.
        Parameters:
        context - Activity which has the template.
        It should be an Activity because the template will close the Activity when the cover is opened.
        If it is null, other APIs will not work and report errors.
        type - type of the design template you want to use.
        If it is null, an empty content template will be used.
        See Also:
        TemplateType

    • Method Detail

      • getLayoutById

        public RelativeLayout getLayoutById(int id)
        gets a layout with the given id.

        This method is useful when you want to add or modify Views of the template.
        Every content or sidebar is a RelativeLayout.

        Parameters:
        id - id of the layout to retrieve. Use TemplateTag.
        Returns:
        a RelativeLayout whose ID is identical to id.
        or null if there is no View with the given ID.

      • getView

        public View getView()
        gets the root view of the template layout.

        Returns:
        root view of the layout.

      • registerIntentReceiver

        public void registerIntentReceiver()
        registers cover event broadcasts.

        The a cover-closed event will make the circle shown and a cover-opened event will make the circle hidden after you invoke this method. The full screen intent will starts if you set a fullscreen intent by calling #setFullscreenIntent(android.content.Intent).

      • setBackButton

        public void setBackButton()
        sets a back button.

        It creates a back button on the bottom of the layout.

        You do not need to implement an onClickListener for the button, because it already has one.
        Note that this method does not create a button when the button already exists.

      • setBackButton

        public void setBackButton(View.OnClickListener onClickListener)
        sets a back button with callback.

        It creates a back button on the bottom of the layout.

        You do not need to implement an onClickListener for the button, because it already has one.
        Note that this method does not create a button when the button already exists.

        Parameters:
        onClickListener - Callback for back button. should be used for closing objects, like camera

      • setBackButtonTheme

        public void setBackButtonTheme(boolean isDark)
        Set the theme to the back button. Default is light.
        Parameters:
        isDark - Is dark theme

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int color,
                      boolean overwiteButtonArea)
        sets the background of the template as the given color.

        The background affects all the layouts including a title bar and a back button.

        Parameters:
        color - background color
        overwiteButtonArea - flag for clear background of the back button if it exists.
        The default background of a back button is light gray. You should clear the background color of a back button when you want to use full-layout background.
        Set this flag in that case.
        See Also:
        #setBackgroundDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable, boolean)

      • setBackgroundDrawable

        public void setBackgroundDrawable(Drawable image,
                         boolean overwiteButtonArea)
        sets the background of the template as the given image.

        The background affects all the layouts including a title bar and a back button.

        Parameters:
        image - background image
        overwiteButtonArea - flag for clear background of the back button if it exists.
        The default background of a back button is light gray. You should clear the background color of a back button when you want to use full-layout background.
        Set this flag in that case.
        See Also:
        setBackgroundColor(int, boolean)

      • setFullscreenIntent

        public void setFullscreenIntent(Intent intent)
        sets the intent running in fullscreen when the cover is opened.
        Parameters:
        intent - intent to run the fullscreen Activity.
        If it is null, nothing will be happened when the cover is opened.
        You can set this as null when you clean up the existing intent.

      • setSidebarRatio

        public boolean setSidebarRatio(float weight)
        changes the ratio of the first sidebar.

        Some design templates have sidebars which is re-sizable. Note that only the first sidebar can be re-sized even if the template has more than 1 sidebars.
        This method changes the size of the first sidebar with the ratio comparing to the full content layout.
        If you add a title bar or a back button after calling this method, the size of the sidebar will not change. Therefore some UI components might be hidden by the title bar or a back button.
        Call this method after adding a title bar and a back button to prevent the situation.

        Parameters:
        weight - ratio of the first sidebar.
        The valid ranage is (0,1). (cannot be 0 or 1).
        Returns:
        true, if the size is changed successfully or
        false, otherwise.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        sets a title.

        It creates a title bar on the top of the layout.

        Note that this method does not create a title bar when the title bar already exists. It changes the text of the existing title bar.

        Parameters:
        title - text for the title.
        If it is null, no title text will be shown but the title bar will occupy some space.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title,
            float heightRatio)
        sets a title with the given height ratio.

        It creates a title bar on the top of the layout. The height of the title bar depends on heightRatio.

        Note that this method does not create a title bar when the title bar already exists. It changes the text and the height of the existing title bar.

        Parameters:
        title - text for the title.
        If it is null, no title text will be shown but the title bar will occupy some space.
        heightRatio - ratio of the title bar.
        If it is less or equal to 0, the height ratio of the title bar will be 0.2 of QuickCircle diameter.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title,
            float heightRatio,
            int textColor,
            int backgroundColor)
        sets a title with the given height ratio and the given title color and background color.

        It creates a title bar on the top of the layout. The height of the title bar depends on heightRatio.

        Note that this method does not create a title bar when the title bar already exists. It changes the text and the height of the existing title bar.

        Parameters:
        title - text for the title.
        If it is null, no title text will be shown but the title bar will occupy some space.
        heightRatio - ratio of the title bar.
        If it is less or equal to 0, the height ratio of the title bar will be 0.2 of QuickCircle diameter.
        textColor - The color of the title
        backgroundColor - The background color of the title

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title,
            int textColor,
            int backgroundColor)
        sets a title with the default height ratio and the given title color and background color.

        It creates a title bar on the top of the layout. The height of the title bar depends on heightRatio.

        Note that this method does not create a title bar when the title bar already exists. It changes the text and the height of the existing title bar.

        Parameters:
        title - text for the title.
        If it is null, no title text will be shown but the title bar will occupy some space.
        textColor - The color of the title
        backgroundColor - The background color of the title

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(View titleView,
            float heightRatio)
        sets a title as the given view with the given height ratio.

        It creates a title bar on the top of the layout. The content of the title bar is titleView and the height of the title bar depends on heightRatio.

        Note that this method does not create a title bar when the title bar already exists. It changes the content and the view of the existing title bar.

        Parameters:
        titleView - View to be a title
        heightRatio - ratio of the title bar.
        If it is less or equal to 0, the height ratio of the title bar will be 0.2 of QuickCircle diameter.

      • setTitleTextSize

        public void setTitleTextSize(float size)
        sets the font size of the title.

        Parameters:
        size - font size in pixel

      • unregisterReceiver

        public void unregisterReceiver()
        un-registers a default broadcast receiver.

        It must be called when {@link #registerIntentReceiver) has been called.
